findings.title: Unprotected initializer
findings.description: The initializer functions __Ownable_init and __Ownable_init_unchained are unprotected.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The contract allows an unauthorized upgrade of its scripts, potentially leading to malicious code execution.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The transfer function does not have any protection mechanism to prevent unauthorized access or malicious activities.

findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function does not have any access control or validation checks, allowing unauthorized users to approve arbitrary amounts.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function lacks protection, allowing unauthorized access and potential token theft.

findings.title: Unprotected increaseAllowance function
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function lacks protection, potentially allowing unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: Unprotected decreaseAllowance function
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function does not have any access control or validation, allowing anyone to decrease the allowance of an arbitrary user.

findings.title: Unprotected _transfer function
findings.description: The _transfer function lacks protection, potentially allowing unauthorized access or malicious activities.

findings.title: Unprotected _mint function
findings.description: The _mint function is not protected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized token creation.

findings.title: Unprotected _burn function
findings.description: The _burn function is internal and lacks access control, allowing unauthorized users to burn tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected _approve function
findings.description: The approve function is exposed without any access control, allowing unauthorized users to call it and potentially drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unprotected _setupDecimals function
findings.description: The _setupDecimals function lacks protection, potentially allowing unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: Unprotected _beforeTokenTransfer function
findings.description: The _beforeTokenTransfer function is not protected and can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected renounceOwnership function
findings.description: The renounceOwnership function can be called by anyone, allowing them to relinquish ownership of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected transferOwnership function
findings.description: The transferOwnership function can be edited, modified or altered by the active owner address.

findings.title: Unprotected distributeCAKEDividends function
findings.description: The distributeCAKEDividends function lacks protection and can be accessed publicly.

findings.title: Unprotected withdrawDividend function
findings.description: The withdrawDividend function is public and lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected _withdrawDividendOfUser function
findings.description: The _withdrawDividendOfUser function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected dividendOf function
findings.description: The dividendOf function is public and can be accessed by anyone without any restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected withdrawableDividendOf function
findings.description: The withdrawableDividendOf function is unprotected and can be accessed by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected withdrawnDividendOf function
findings.description: The withdrawnDividendOf function is declared as external and does not have any access modifiers, making it unprotected.

findings.title: Unprotected accumulativeDividendOf function
findings.description: The accumulativeDividendOf function is declared as public and does not have any access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected _setBalance function
findings.description: The internal _setBalance function is not protected and can be accessed by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes to user balances.
